title: Thunderbird on new computer won't log into my server
content: I just bought a new laptop and installed Thunderbird, which I have been using since Moses. When I tried setting it up with my ISP server, I tried IMAP, but it wouldn't let me log in, saying invalid password, using the same password I have been using since Abraham. I then realized what I really wanted was POP, so I could store my emails on my computer. So, I tried that but got the same results. I've not had this problem with other new computers I have bought. It has always been seamless. So, what do I need to do to get past this? Thanks.
creator: Cris47

title: Outlook/Google Calendar Sync?
content:
Hello first sorry if this has been posted before and I missed it.

Been looking for an alternative email client since Microsoft is changing over to their clunky web mail app in windows.

Been trying out Thunderbird (version 115) added my Outlook/Microsoft account which works fine email wise but the calendar does not show up. I can add the same account or my google account to say EM mail or mailbird and the calendar shows/syncs up s in those programs effortlessly.

Does this not work the same in Thunderbird or do I need some extra plug ins? I seen trying to share and export the ics file but I just want to sync it like any other program.

Thanks for your help
creator: redfox_11

title: Supernova + iCloud Sync?
content: Hey Fam! Congrats on a superb delivery! Quick question - for iCloud users when can we expect to be able to use the TBSync addon to support syncing key data? Thanks!
creator: tlbrooks03

title: Move TB emails from Windows 7 to windows 11
content: When moving the old "profiles" folder from a windows 7 computer to a new windows 11 computer that already has TB installed and running, will adding the old profile the current TB emails and folders as is, or will it erase the current information. Not a lot of emails or folders on the new computer but still don't want to lose that info. Sincerely, Tom / G T Inc.
creator: hummerproducts1
